means: [人名] [苏格兰人、爱尔兰人姓氏] 克洛伊 Lewis的变体

sentence.Network_en: After a while, the rich sauce begins to cloy.
sentence.Network_cn: 过了一会儿，浓味沙司开始显得油腻了。

sentence.Network_en: Chocolates start to cloy if you eat too much.
sentence.Network_cn: 假如你吃太多巧克力会使你倒胃口.

sentence.Network_en: Chocolates start to cloy if you eat too many.
sentence.Network_cn: 巧克力糖吃太多就会腻.

list.abs: and the cloying perfumes of spring ., 春天的香气令他们厌烦.
a cloying smile , manner ., 嬉皮笑脸的微笑 , 态度.
a love story full of cloying sentiment ., 通篇缠绵伤感的爱情小说.

Too much spicy food cloyed his appetite ., 太多的辛辣食物令他失去了胃口.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: shortening of obsolete accloy 'stop up, choke', from Old French encloyer 'drive a nail into', from medieval Latin inclavare, from clavus 'a nail'

means.word_mean: 2. cause surfeit through excess though initially pleasing;

sentences.sentence: "Too much spicy food cloyed his appetite"

auth_sentence.content: His sentimentality may cloy with some, but few can criticise such unaffected delivery.
auth_sentence.res_content: His sentimentality may cloy with some, but few can criticise such unaffected delivery.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: His sentimentality may cloy with some, but few can criticise such unaffected delivery.

auth_sentence.content: But its quaint appearance belies a rough-and-ready past, so the cuteness doesn't cloy.
auth_sentence.res_content: But its quaint appearance belies a rough-and-ready past, so the cuteness doesn't cloy.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: But its quaint appearance belies a rough-and-ready past, so the cuteness doesn't cloy.

sentences.en: Too much sweet food cloys the palate.
sentences.cn: 吃过多的甜食会使人倒胃口。
